channel.title: AI & Telecom News Digest
channel.description: Daily AI & Telecom insights curated by n8n + Perplexity

item.title: Untitled
item.description: Telecom companies must adopt generative AI to reduce costs, drive growth, improve security, and transform into technology-driven service providers.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: The article highlights 150 AI use cases from startups like Cursor, an AI-powered code editor with advanced generative AI and autonomous agent features.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: The telecom industry is rapidly adopting generative AI, with half of surveyed companies having already implemented initial AI solutions by 2025.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: The article discusses how generative AI, zero trust, and quantum encryption are driving innovation and enhanced security in the telecom industry's next growth wave.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: Deloitte's 2025 telecom outlook highlights telcos exploring opportunities to leverage generative AI as a key growth driver across industries.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: A new report urges telcos to adopt Gen AI to boost productivity, as 83% of leaders fear being left behind in the evolving industry landscape.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: ZTE advances intelligent network solutions by integrating AI technologies to enhance telecommunications infrastructure and services.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: Malaysia launches Ryt Bank, its first AI-powered bank, while Google's Veo 3 AI video creation tools become widely available, showcasing AI's transformative impact on finance and media.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: Singtel Enterprise aims to become an AI-first telco by investing in AI, network slicing, digital twins, and autonomous networks.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: The Fed highlights that the rapid growth of AI workloads is significantly increasing data center electricity demand in advanced economies.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: EY warns the telecom sector faces increasing risks from AI challenges, ineffective transformation, and a complex geopolitical environment.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: TelefÃ³nica highlights major hyperscalers like AWS, Azure, and GCP integrating generative AI, foundational models, and synthetic data as key trends shaping the future of public clouds.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: The Richmond Fed questions whether current AI investments mirror the 1990s telecom boom and bust, cautioning about a potential AI bubble.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: A global study of 100+ tier-1 telecom executives reveals significant opportunities and practical applications for generative AI in the telecom industry.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: Generative AI is revolutionizing telecom by serving as a reliable knowledge base for AI-powered network management and optimization.
